results.title: Electrical engineering
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
The provision of power supplies and telephone communications systems, plus the design and manufacture of electrical equipment. Gives an insight into the type of work covered by this career. The varied nature of electrical engineering, and the planning and estimating ability which are necessary, and the educational requirements are shown.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.

results.title: Economics
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
The economist is presented as a sort of management advisor to business or government. Outlines what is meant by “forces in the economy” through the activities of people. It then becomes possible to suggest the need for an understanding of these “forces” so that they may be kept operating satisfactorily. The role of the economist in business is shown.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.

results.title: Commercial art
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Several years of full-time study requiring imagination, patience and the ability to express ideas in words, as well as in pictures. Stresses that even after training, a job may be hard to find. Shows a young artist in an advertising agency learning to accept criticism of simple jobs, before moving on to more demanding work.
results.description:

results.title: Clerical work
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
This is a field of work with many opportunities: secretaries, optometrists, general clerks, receptionists, bank teller, enquiry clerk, accountant and section head. Shows that with machines performing the monotonous jobs, todays office work is concerned more with planning and people. Part of the “Is this your career?”series.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
This is a field of work with many opportunities: secretaries, optometrists, general clerks, receptionists, bank teller, enquiry clerk, accountant and section head. Shows that with machines performing the monotonous jobs, todays office work is concerned more with planning and people. Part of the “Is this your career?”series.

results.title: Civil engineering
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Life and Citizens' Assurance Co.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
By showing civil engineers at work, the wide ramifications of their profession are indicated, from specialists in investigation, to those who handle design, detailed planning, or administration. The need for mathematical ability, and an understanding of the properties of materials emerges.

results.title: Chemical engineering
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
The chemical engineer applies engineering principles for chemical purposes, and works with the chemist and mechanical engineer. The design, erection and economical operation of chemical plants is his responsibility. He may have to analyse much data and prepare reports on plant operation. His grasp of maths must be strong and the computer is one of his tools. The university course indicates the wide field covered by his training.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.

results.title: Catering and hotel management
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Life and Citizens' Assurance Co.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Good catering entails the management and supervision of staff, and the bulk ordering and preparation of food. The various applications of this work in hospitals, canteens and hotels demonstrates the degree of skilled knowledge which is required.

results.title: Building trades
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
A vocational guidance film showing the work of tradesmen in the construction of a house, an office block or a factory, including bricklayers, plasterers, tilers and carpenters. Discusses careers available to building tradesmen as supervisors or in their own building companies.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.

results.title: Architecture
results.creator_credit: Career Productions, Citizen's Assurance and Mutual Life and Citizens' Assurance Co.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
The architect is trained to understand the needs of people and how labour, machines and materials can create buildings which meet these needs. Although he may arrange for the help of special experts such as structural or lighting engineers he too must have a grasp of these technical matters.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Career Productions, Citizen’s Assurance and Mutual Life and Citizens’ Assurance Co.
